35 
36 from __future__ import print_function
37 
38 """
39 clean_junit_xml.py is a simple script that takes all the xml-formatted
40 Ant JUnit XML test output in test_results and aggregates them into
41 test_results/_hudson. In this process, it strips any characters that
42 tend to cause Hudson trouble.
43 """
44 
45 import os
46 import sys
47 
48 import rospkg
49 
50 import rosunit.junitxml as junitxml
51 
52 PKG = 'rosunit'
53 
54 
55 def prepare_dirs(output_dir_name):
56  test_results_dir = rospkg.get_test_results_dir()
57  print('will read test results from', test_results_dir)
58  output_dir = os.path.join(test_results_dir, output_dir_name)
59  if not os.path.exists(output_dir):
60  print('creating directory', output_dir)
61  os.makedirs(output_dir)
62  return test_results_dir, output_dir
63 
64 
65 def clean_results(test_results_dir, output_dir, filter):
66  """
67  Read results from test_results_dir and write them into output_dir.
68  """
69  for d in os.listdir(test_results_dir):
70  if filter and d in filter:
71  continue
72  print('looking at', d)
73  test_dir = os.path.join(test_results_dir, d)
74  if not os.path.isdir(test_dir):
75  continue
76  base_test_name = os.path.basename(test_dir)
77  # for each test result that a package generated, read it, then
78  # rewrite it to our output directory. This will invoke our
79  # cleaning rules on the XML that protect the result from Hudson
80  # issues.
81  for file in os.listdir(test_dir):
82  if file.endswith('.xml'):
83  test_name = base_test_name + '.' + file[:-4]
84  file = os.path.join(test_dir, file)
85  try:
86  result = junitxml.read(file, test_name)
87  output_path = os.path.join(output_dir, '%s.xml' % test_name)
88  with open(output_path, 'w') as f:
89  print('re-writing', output_path)
90  f.write(result.xml().encode('utf-8'))
91  except Exception as e:
92  sys.stderr.write('ignoring [%s]: %s\n' % (file, e))
93 
94 
95 def main():
96 
97  print('[clean_junit_xml]: STARTING')
98 
99  output_dir_name = '_hudson'
100  test_results_dir, output_dir = prepare_dirs(output_dir_name)
101 
102  print('[clean_junit_xml]: writing aggregated test results to %s' % output_dir)
103 
104  clean_results(test_results_dir, output_dir, [output_dir_name, '.svn'])
105 
106  print('[clean_junit_xml]: FINISHED')
107 
108 
109 if __name__ == '__main__':
110  main()
clean_junit_xml.prepare_dirs
def prepare_dirs(output_dir_name)
